body:
The attachment you provided is not a gzipped tarball, FYI. Just a tar file.

```
><> tar xzf chart.tar.gz

gzip: stdin: not in gzip format
tar: Child returned status 1
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
```

`tar xf chart.tar.gz` works fine.

I can reproduce this behaviour via the values file.

```
/tmp/test-9027/demo ><> helm template .
---
# Source: demo/charts/subchart/templates/values.yaml
global:
  hash:
    key1: 1
    key2: 2
    key3: 13
    key4: 4
    key5: 5
    key6: 6
hash:
  key1: 1
  key2: 2
  key3: 13
  key4: 4
  key5: 5
  key6: 6
```

However, this can be worked around by setting a value via `--set` to `null`.

```
/tmp/test-9027/demo ><> helm template . --set subchart.hash.key1=null,subchart.hash.key2=null
---
# Source: demo/charts/subchart/templates/values.yaml
global:
  hash:
    key1: 1
    key2: 2
    key3: 13
    key4: 4
    key5: 5
    key6: 6
hash:
  key3: 13
  key4: 4
  key5: 5
  key6: 6
```

This to me seems like something to do with the YAML parser where a null value is not received or parsed, whereas the `--set` parser can pick up these null values and propagate them down the tree as needed.

Thanks for the info about the attachment, I add a note.

If you are removing

```
dependencies:
  - name: subchart
    version: 0.1.0
```

from Chart.yaml everything works as expected. 

I don't know if the YAML parser is wrong here but it seems like there is a different code path if dependencies are defined.

I am seeing a similar problem, except it's one layer deeper: I'm including [loki-stack](https://github.com/grafana/loki/tree/master/production/helm/loki-stack) as a sub-chart, which then has the `loki` chart as a sub-chart.

I am trying to remove the resulting `loki-stack.loki.config.storage_config.filesystem` key, which i can only do using `helm template --set loki-stack.loki.config.storage_config.filesystem=null` (as you also observed).

The only practical workaround appears to be to extract the chart locally and remove the actual default value itself.

Basic reproducer (helm version i used: v3.4.1):
- Chart.yaml with the loki-stack chart as dependency
- Override to delete in `values.yaml`:
```yaml
loki-stack:
  loki:
    config:
      storage_config:
        filesystem: null
```
- Run template and check the loki secret

My workaround conflicts with

https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/3585

If no dependencies are defined, `helm lint` will fail.
This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.

issue.title: Make cookie `expires` & `maxAge` option can be unset via Helm chart config

repository.name: magda
repository.description: A federated, open-source data catalog for all your big data and small data

issue.body:
## Make cookie `expires` & `maxAge` option can be unset via Helm chart config

We have Gateway config that allows users to config cookie options:

https://github.com/magda-io/magda/tree/master/deploy/helm/internal-charts/gateway

Due to this issue: https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/9027

There is no way at this moment to unset a key in helm config default values.

This ticket is about allow `expires` & `maxAge` of cookie options to be unset via setting a boolean value `false`.

body: This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.
This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.

I'm observing the same issue with helm 3.7.0 
```
$helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.7.0", GitCommit:"eeac83883cb4014fe60267ec6373570374ce770b", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.16.8"}
```

My case - I want to change `livenessProbe` for Fluent Bit. 
I can change `livenessProbe` when I deploy Fluent Bit Helm Chart:
```bash
helm repo add fluent-bit https://fluent.github.io/helm-charts
helm repo update

helm install test fluent-bit/fluent-bit --version 0.12.1 -f values-fluentbit.yaml
```
where `values-fluentbit.yaml` has this content:
```yaml
livenessProbe:
  httpGet: null
  exec:
    command:
    - /bin/bash
    - -exc
    - >
      function getOutTotalF0() { curl -s --connect-timeout 5 --retry 3 -f http://localhost:2020/api/v1/metrics/prometheus |grep '^fluentbit_output_proc_records_total{name="forward.0"}' | awk '{print $2}' ;};
      T=$(getOutTotalF0);test -e ./m_oprtf0 && { test $(cat ./m_oprtf0) -ge $T && { echo "OutputRecordsTotal Forward0 freeze: $T"; exit 1;} ;}; test $T -ge -10 && { echo "$T" >| ./m_oprtf0; } || true;
  initialDelaySeconds: 120
  periodSeconds: 60
  failureThreshold: 8
  timeoutSeconds: 5
```
and livenessProbe is correctly set:
```
$ kubectl get pods test-fluent-bit-gwv2g -o yaml
...
  containers:
  - image: fluent/fluent-bit:1.6.10
    imagePullPolicy: Always
    livenessProbe:
      exec:
        command:
        - /bin/bash
        - -exc
        - |
          function getOutTotalF0() { curl -s --connect-timeout 5 --retry 3 -f http://localhost:2020/api/v1/metrics/prometheus |grep '^fluentbit_output_proc_records_total{name="forward.0"}' | awk '{print $2}' ;}; T=$(getOutTotalF0);test -e ./m_oprtf0 && { test $(cat ./m_oprtf0) -ge $T && { echo "OutputRecordsTotal Forward0 freeze: $T"; exit 1;} ;}; test $T -ge -10 && { echo "$T" >| ./m_oprtf0; } || true;
      failureThreshold: 8
      initialDelaySeconds: 120
      periodSeconds: 60
      successThreshold: 1
      timeoutSeconds: 5
...
```

when Fluent Bit is a sub chart in [sumologic helm chart ](https://github.com/SumoLogic/sumologic-kubernetes-collection) then default key from Fluent Bit helm chart is not removed, steps to reproduce:
```
helm repo add sumologic https://sumologic.github.io/sumologic-kubernetes-collection
helm repo update

# Deploy receiver mock - needed to test sumologic helm chart
kubectl apply -f "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SumoLogic/sumologic-kubernetes-collection/release-v2.1/vagrant/k8s/receiver-mock.yaml"

helm upgrade --install collection sumologic/sumologic \
  --namespace=sumologic \
  --version 2.1.5 \
  -f values_sumologic.yaml
```

where `values_sumologic.yaml` has this content:
```
sumologic:
  accessId: "dummy"
  accessKey: "dummy"
  endpoint: http://receiver-mock.receiver-mock:3000/terraform/api/

fluent-bit:
  livenessProbe:
    httpGet: null
    exec:
      command:
      - /bin/bash
      - -exc
      - >
        function getOutTotalF0() { curl -s --connect-timeout 5 --retry 3 -f http://localhost:2020/api/v1/metrics/prometheus |grep '^fluentbit_output_proc_records_total{name="forward.0"}' | awk '{print $2}' ;};
        T=$(getOutTotalF0);test -e ./m_oprtf0 && { test $(cat ./m_oprtf0) -ge $T && { echo "OutputRecordsTotal Forward0 freeze: $T"; exit 1;} ;}; test $T -ge -10 && { echo "$T" >| ./m_oprtf0; } || true;
    initialDelaySeconds: 120
    periodSeconds: 60
    failureThreshold: 8
    timeoutSeconds: 5
```
I'm getting this error in output from `helm upgrade`:
```
DaemonSet.apps "collection-fluent-bit" is invalid: spec.template.spec.containers[0].livenessProbe.httpGet: Forbidden: may not specify more than 1 handler type
```
in output from dry-run I see that default key from Fluent Bit helm chart is not deleted:
```yaml
          livenessProbe:
            exec:
              command:
              - /bin/bash
              - -exc
              - |
                function getOutTotalF0() { curl -s --connect-timeout 5 --retry 3 -f http://localhost:2020/api/v1/metrics/prometheus |grep '^fluentbit_output_proc_records_total{name="forward.0"}' | awk '{print $2}' ;}; T=$(getOutTotalF0);test -e ./m_oprtf0 && { test $(cat ./m_oprtf0) -ge $T && { echo "OutputRecordsTotal Forward0 freeze: $T"; exit 1;} ;}; test $T -ge -10 && { echo "$T" >| ./m_oprtf0; } || true;
            failureThreshold: 8
            httpGet:
              path: /
              port: http
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 60
```


when deploy sumologic helm chart from source and  I remove `dependencies` from `Chart.yaml` then default key from Fluent Bit sub chart is removed as it is configured, steps:
```
helm repo add sumologic https://sumologic.github.io/sumologic-kubernetes-collection
helm repo update

kubectl apply -f "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SumoLogic/sumologic-kubernetes-collection/release-v2.1/vagrant/k8s/receiver-mock.yaml"

helm pull  sumologic/sumologic --version 2.1.5 --untar

(helm dep update sumologic/ && cd sumologic/charts && for filename in *.tgz; do tar -xf "$filename" && rm -f "$filename"; done;)

patch sumologic/Chart.yaml Chart.patch

helm upgrade --install collection sumologic/ -f values_sumologic.yaml
``` 
livenessProbe is correctly set:
```
$ kubectl get pods collection-fluent-bit-plb8f -o yaml 
    image: public.ecr.aws/sumologic/fluent-bit:1.6.10
    imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
    livenessProbe:
      exec:
        command:
        - /bin/bash
        - -exc
        - |
          function getOutTotalF0() { curl -s --connect-timeout 5 --retry 3 -f http://localhost:2020/api/v1/metrics/prometheus |grep '^fluentbit_output_proc_records_total{name="forward.0"}' | awk '{print $2}' ;}; T=$(getOutTotalF0);test -e ./m_oprtf0 && { test $(cat ./m_oprtf0) -ge $T && { echo "OutputRecordsTotal Forward0 freeze: $T"; exit 1;} ;}; test $T -ge -10 && { echo "$T" >| ./m_oprtf0; } || true;
      failureThreshold: 8
      initialDelaySeconds: 120
      periodSeconds: 60
      successThreshold: 1
      timeoutSeconds: 5
```

content of `Chart.patch`:
```
--- sumologic/Chart.yaml	2021-09-21 12:31:04.000000000 +0000
+++ ../sumologic/Chart.yaml	2021-09-21 12:36:42.000000000 +0000
@@ -1,30 +1,5 @@
 apiVersion: v2
 appVersion: 2.1.5
-dependencies:
-- condition: fluent-bit.enabled,sumologic.logs.enabled
-  name: fluent-bit
-  repository: https://fluent.github.io/helm-charts
-  version: 0.12.1
-- condition: kube-prometheus-stack.enabled,sumologic.metrics.enabled
-  name: kube-prometheus-stack
-  repository: https://prometheus-community.github.io/helm-charts
-  version: 12.3.0
-- condition: falco.enabled
-  name: falco
-  repository: https://falcosecurity.github.io/charts
-  version: 1.7.10
-- condition: metrics-server.enabled
-  name: metrics-server
-  repository: https://charts.bitnami.com/bitnami
-  version: 5.8.4
-- condition: telegraf-operator.enabled
-  name: telegraf-operator
-  repository: https://helm.influxdata.com/
-  version: 1.1.5
-- condition: tailing-sidecar-operator.enabled
-  name: tailing-sidecar-operator
-  repository: https://sumologic.github.io/tailing-sidecar
-  version: 0.3.1
 description: A Helm chart for collecting Kubernetes logs, metrics, traces and events
   into Sumo Logic.
 home: https://github.com/SumoLogic/sumologic-kubernetes-collection
```
This issue is such pain in the ass. Please fix it asap.

Starting having this issue again with helm Version:"v3.7.2". In previous versions I used to carry a null configuration key as such.

```
livenessProbe:
      httpGet:
      exec:
        command:
        - /bin/bash
        - -exc
        [...]
```

Leaving **httpGet** empty in outer values would override the httpGet probe from community chart values.

Now this workaround doesn't do anymore, the resulting template has two probes and helm installation trips over _Forbidden: may not specify more than 1 handler type_

issue.title: [victoria-metrics-operator] Do not specify default resources

repository.name: helm-charts
repository.description: Helm charts for VictoriaMetrics, VictoriaLogs and ecosystem

issue.body:
Hi,

This is a tiny change to prevent setting default resources for the Operator. Helm recommends not to specify default resources and to leave this as a conscious choice for the user.

We currently have two issues with default resources:
1. Using CPU limits leads to unnecessary throttling - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/67577
2. We can not unset the cpu limit key in a sub-chart due to a bug in Helm - https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/9027

Most community helm charts do not set resources but provide guidance with some commented values instead. 

Thanks!

issue.title: Do not set resource limits

repository.name: helm-charts
repository.description: Community maintained Helm charts for Flux

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to fluxcd-community/helm-charts.
Before you submit this PR we'd like to make sure you are aware of our technical requirements and best practices:

* https://github.com/fluxcd-community/helm-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#technical-requirements
* https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/

Please make sure you test your changes before you push them.
Once pushed, GitHub Actions will run across your changes and do some initial checks and linting.
These checks run very quickly.
Please check the results.
We would like these checks to pass before we even continue reviewing your changes.
-->
#### What this PR does / why we need it:
This PR removes default values for resource.limits. Helm recommends not to specify default resources and to leave this as a conscious choice for the user.
We currently have two issues with default resources:
1. Using CPU limits leads to unnecessary throttling - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/67577
2. We can not unset the cpu limit key in a sub-chart due to a bug in Helm - https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/9027

Most community helm charts do not set resources but provide guidance with some commented values instead. 

Thanks!

#### Which issue this PR fixes
N/A

#### Special notes for your reviewer:

#### Checklist
<!-- [Place an '[x]' (no spaces) in all applicable fields. Please remove unrelated fields.] -->
- [x] [DCO](https://github.com/fluxcd-community/helm-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#sign-off-your-work) signed
- [x] Chart Version bumped
- [x] helm-docs are updated
- [x] Helm chart is tested
- [x] Update artifacthub.io/changes in Chart.yaml
- [x] Run `make reviewable`

body: This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.
This is so inconvenient! How can it be ignored for so long?
